meanings.definition: A place where weapons are stored.
meanings.sent1: The armories were filled with swords and shields.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers visited the armories to get their weapons before battle.
meanings.sent3: The armories were so full that they couldn't fit another arrow!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an armory of knowledge, ready to be shared with anyone who asked.
meanings.sent5: The armories gleamed with the polished metal of countless weapons.

meanings.definition: A collection of weapons and military equipment.
meanings.sent1: The armories displayed an impressive array of firearms.
meanings.sent2: The general inspected the armories to ensure all weapons were accounted for.
meanings.sent3: The armories were like a treasure trove of ancient swords and armor.
meanings.sent4: His words were sharp as the swords in the armories, cutting through any argument.
meanings.sent5: The armories stood as a testament to the strength and history of the kingdom.

meanings.definition: A building used for storing weapons and military equipment.
meanings.sent1: The armories were strategically located near the barracks for easy access.
meanings.sent2: The armories were fortified to protect the valuable weapons inside.
meanings.sent3: The armories were so well-guarded, even the mice couldn't sneak in!
meanings.sent4: Her heart was an armory of love, ready to defend those she cared for.
meanings.sent5: The armories loomed large against the horizon, a symbol of strength and security.
